com.codename1.components.xmlview

Class XMLView

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.codename1.ui.Component
      • com.codename1.ui.Container
        • com.codename1.components.xmlview.XMLView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.codename1.ui.animations.Animation, com.codename1.ui.events.StyleListener, java.lang.Iterable<com.codename1.ui.Component>

    public class XMLView
extends com.codename1.ui.Container
    A component that renders XML content as a visual component. Works like an HTML viewer, except that it is far more minimal, performant, and extensible.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  XMLView.ViewFactory
      Interface to be implemented by all view factories.

      • getPlaceholderImage

        public com.codename1.ui.EncodedImage getPlaceholderImage(java.lang.String name,
                                                         int aspectPreference)
        Gets a placeholder image.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the placeholder image.
        aspectPreference - The aspect ratio preference. One of ASPECT_16X9 and ASPECT_SQUARE.
        Returns:
        Placeholder image with specified name and aspect ration preference.

      • getImage

        public com.codename1.ui.Image getImage(java.lang.String url,
                                       java.lang.String placeholder,
                                       int aspectPreference)
        Gets an image from a particular URL and stretches it to the given aspect ratio.
        Parameters:
        url - The URL of the image.
        placeholder - The placeholder for the image.
        aspectPreference - Preferred aspect ratio for the image.
        Returns:
        The image at the given URL.

      • getIcon

        public com.codename1.ui.Image getIcon(java.lang.String charCode,
                                      int width,
                                      int height,
                                      int color)
        Gets a font icon for a particular character code in a specified width, height, and color
        Parameters:
        charCode - The char code to display.
        width - The width of the rendered icon.
        height - The height of the rendered icon.
        color - THe color of the rendered icon.
        Returns:
        Prerendered image of the icon.

      • getIcon

        public com.codename1.ui.Image getIcon(java.lang.String charCode,
                                      int width,
                                      int height)
        Gets image icon using the icon font. Default icon font is fontawesome.
        Parameters:
        charCode - The char code to render. This is font-dependent.
        width - The width to render the image in px.
        height - The height to render the image in px.
        Returns:
        The Image with the icon rendered with the given character code. From FontAwesome.

      • setXML

        public void setXML(java.lang.String xml,
                   java.lang.String base)
        Sets the XML contents of the view.
        Parameters:
        xml - The XML to render.
        base - The base URL of the document. This is used to retrieve relative resources like images that are referenced in the document.

      • setXML

        public void setXML(java.lang.String xml)
        Sets the XML contents of the view. The base URL will be taken from the "base" attribute of either the root element, the head element, or the body element.
        Parameters:
        xml - The XML to load.

      • setXML

        public void setXML(com.codename1.xml.Element root,
                   java.lang.String base)
        Sets the XML contents to view.
        Parameters:
        root - The root XML element to display.
        base - The base URL. Used for retrieving dependent resources like images that are referenced using a relative path.

      • setXML

        public void setXML(com.codename1.xml.Element root)
        Sets the XML contents of the view. The base URL will be extracted from the "base" attribute of the root element, the head element, or the body element.
        Parameters:
        root - The root element to display.

      • createView

        public com.codename1.ui.Component createView(com.codename1.xml.Element el)
        Creates a view for the given XML element. This will check each registered view factory to see if it supports the element, and will return the component generated by the first factory that supports it. If none can be found, then this will return null.
        Parameters:
        el - The XML element to convert to a view.
        Returns:
        The generated component or null if no factories are registered for this element.

      • toAbsoluteUrl

        public java.lang.String toAbsoluteUrl(java.lang.String url)
        Converts a url to an absolute URL. This is idempotent.
        Parameters:
        url - The URL to convert.
        Returns:
        The resulting absolute URL.

      • registerViewFactory

        public void registerViewFactory(java.lang.String tagName,
                                XMLView.ViewFactory factory)
        Registers a view factory with the view.
        Parameters:
        tagName - The tag name that the view factory processes.
        factory - The view factory.

      • load

        public void load(java.lang.String url,
                 com.codename1.util.Callback<com.codename1.xml.Element> callback)
        Loads an XML page from a url. This will load asynchronously.
        Parameters:
        url - The URL to load.
        callback - A callback that is called when loading is complete.
